data.question: What is the purpose of using a post-assembly modification strategy in the synthesis of metal-organic frameworks?
data.answer: The purpose is to extend and fix a metal-organic cage into a porous framework, improving its stability in the crystal state and making it easier to study the host–guest behavior of solid-state metal-organic cages through single-crystal diffraction techniques.

data.question: What are the main applications of metal-organic cages (MOCs) mentioned in the text?
data.answer: MOCs are broadly applicable to molecular encapsulation, catalysis, and biological sensing.

data.question: True or False: The study of host-guest interactions for most metal-organic cages (MOCs) is carried out in the solid state.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the role of the Ti4L6 cage in the synthesis of PTC-236 frameworks?
data.answer: The Ti4L6 cage acts as a 4-connecting crystal engineering tecton and a precursor for post-assembly modification, leading to the synthesis of homochiral cage-based microporous frameworks PTC-236(Δ) and PTC-236(Λ).

data.question: What property of PTC-236 frameworks facilitates the study of host-guest chemistry?
data.answer: PTC-236 frameworks have rich recognition sites provided by the Ti4L6 moieties, chiral channels, and high framework stability, which facilitate the study of host-guest chemistry via single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformation.

data.question: True or False: PTC-236 frameworks are unstable in water and common solvents.
data.answer: False

data.question: How were homochiral ΔΔΔΔ- and ΛΛΛΛ-[Ti4L6] cages obtained?
data.answer: Homochiral ΔΔΔΔ- and ΛΛΛΛ-[Ti4L6] cages were obtained through optical resolution, using enantiopure left- and right-handed cations.

data.question: What is the significance of the solid-state CD spectra in the study?
data.answer: The solid-state CD spectra reveal the enantiomeric nature and absolute configuration of the PTC-236 frameworks, confirming their homochiral characteristics.

data.question: True or False: PTC-236 frameworks can selectively separate trans-CIN from its isomeric mixture.
data.answer: True

data.question: What experimental technique is commonly used to investigate host-guest interactions between MOCs and adsorbed guest species?
data.answer: NMR spectroscopy and ESI-MS analyses are commonly used.

data.question: True or False: The PTC-236 frameworks were synthesized using a pre-assembly modification strategy.
data.answer: False

data.question: What challenge does the study address in the field of metal-organic cages?
data.answer: The study addresses the challenge of studying host-guest complexes at the molecular level in the solid state, which requires high-quality single crystals of host MOC.

data.question: True or False: The PTC-236 frameworks are amorphous powders with poor structural stability and crystallinity.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the role of the bimb ligand in the structure of PTC-236?
data.answer: The bimb ligand connects Zn1 atoms in an infinite helical chain along the c-axis, forming triple-stranded right-handed helical chains that are linked together by ΛΛΛΛ-[Ti4L6] cages, contributing to the homochiral framework of PTC-236.

data.question: True or False: The PTC-236 frameworks have a limited ability to undergo single-crystal-to-single-crystal (SC-SC) transformation.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the maximum crystal size of PTC-236 that was achieved?
data.answer: The maximum crystal size of PTC-236 achieved was 8 mm.

data.question: True or False: The PTC-236 frameworks are only applicable for the recognition and separation of molecular isomers.
data.answer: False

data.question: How does the PTC-236 framework demonstrate enantioselective separation?
data.answer: PTC-236 demonstrates enantioselective separation by preferentially trapping one enantiomer over the other from racemic mixtures, as shown in the separation of 1-phenethylalcohol (PEOH) and other racemates.

data.question: What is the significance of the pH stability of PTC-236?
data.answer: The pH stability of PTC-236, being stable in HCl or NaOH aqueous solutions at pH 5–9, indicates its robustness and suitability for various applications under different pH conditions.

data.question: True or False: The PTC-236 frameworks can only trap aromatic guests through hydrogen bonding.
data.answer: False
